intro: Ferula gouliminensis, commonly known as the Kashmiri ferula, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stem and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various bioactive compounds, making it of interest in traditional medicine. Its leaves are aromatic and often used in local remedies for their purported healing properties. Ferula gouliminensis thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to survive in harsh mountainous regions.
